features.title: Select Features (Step 2 of 6)
features.description:
Choose which features to enable for **{room_name}**.

**All features are recommended for best performance!**

These determine which helper entities will be created and which automation features will be available.

climate_entities.title: Select Climate Entities (Step 3 of 6)
climate_entities.description:
Select the A/C unit(s) for **{room_name}**.

You can select multiple A/C units if your room has more than one.

**Tip:** If you don't see your A/C, make sure it's properly integrated in Home Assistant first.

sensors.title: Select Sensors (Step 4 of 6)
sensors.description:
Configure optional sensors for **{room_name}**.

**All sensors are optional but recommended for best accuracy!**

**Temperature Sensor:** External thermometer for more accurate readings

**Room Presence Sensors:** Add your BLE sensors (e.g., sensor.phone_ble_area), motion sensors (PIR), mmWave sensors, or any occupancy detection sensors.

**ğŸ›ï¸ For Bedrooms:** Include bed occupancy sensors (e.g., binary_sensor.bed_occupancy) for sleep detection! You can select multiple sensors for better accuracy.

presence_detection.title: Home/Away Detection (Step 4.5 of 6)
presence_detection.description:
**Configure home/away presence detection for {room_name}.**

**Person Entities (Recommended):**
Select people to track for home/away detection and proximity-based pre-conditioning.

**Why add these even if you have room sensors?**
â€¢ âœ… Enables Auto mode as fallback option
â€¢ âœ… Allows switching between Smart and Auto modes
â€¢ âœ… Provides house-wide automation when needed

**Presence Devices (Optional):**
Additional devices that indicate someone is home (PC power, TV, gaming console, etc.)

**ğŸ¯ Smart Mode Selection:**
â€¢ **With room sensors** â†’ Defaults to Smart mode (room-specific)
â€¢ **Without room sensors** â†’ Defaults to Auto mode (house-wide)
â€¢ **Both available** â†’ You can switch modes anytime!

**Start cooling/heating BEFORE you arrive home!**

**How it works:**
â€¢ ğŸš— Tracks your location via GPS (phone)
â€¢ ğŸ¯ Detects when heading towards home
â€¢ â„ï¸ Starts conditioning when within range
â€¢ âœ¨ Room is comfortable when you arrive

**Setup Status:** {home_zone_status}

**Setup Requirements:**
1. **Home zone** (Settings â†’ Areas â†’ Zones â†’ Create "Home" zone)
2. **Proximity integration** (Settings â†’ Integrations â†’ Add â†’ Proximity)
   - Select "home" zone

**Don't have Proximity setup?**

**Already have Proximity?**
Check the box below and select your sensors!

Is **{room_name}** a bedroom with a bed occupancy sensor?

**ğŸ›ï¸ BEDROOM Mode Benefits:**
â€¢ Detects presence when sleeping (bed sensor)
â€¢ Detects presence when awake (motion sensor)
â€¢ Prevents false positives (phone left behind)
â€¢ Works with any sensor combination

**Select YES if:**
â€¢ This is a bedroom
â€¢ You added a bed occupancy sensor above
â€¢ You want the AC to stay on while sleeping

**Select NO for:**
â€¢ Living rooms, offices, other areas
â€¢ Bedrooms without bed sensors

**Just 2 simple questions!** ğŸŒ¡ï¸ The wizard automatically calculates ALL temperature thresholds for **{room_name}**.

**Choose your comfort style:**
â€¢ **Tight** (Â±0.5Â°C): Precise control, 20+ AC cycles/day
â€¢ **Balanced** (Â±1.0Â°C): â­ Recommended, 10-15 cycles/day
â€¢ **Relaxed** (Â±1.5Â°C): Energy saving, 5-10 cycles/day

**Example:** 23Â°C Â± 1.0Â°C means:
â€¢ Comfort zone: 22.0Â°C - 24.0Â°C (AC off)
â€¢ Gentle cooling starts: 24.1Â°C
â€¢ Medium cooling starts: 25.0Â°C
â€¢ Max cooling starts: 26.0Â°C
â€¢ *(Heating thresholds calculated similarly)*

**What happens next:**
âœ… All 6 temperature tiers calculated automatically

**Note:** Changing these options will NOT automatically create or delete helpers or modify the automation.
